00025 #ifndef INCLUDE_git_tree_h__
00026 #define INCLUDE_git_tree_h__
00027 
00028 #include "common.h"
00029 #include "types.h"
00030 #include "oid.h"
00031 #include "object.h"
00032 
00033 /**
00034  * @file git2/tree.h
00035  * @brief Git tree parsing, loading routines
00036  * @defgroup git_tree Git tree parsing, loading routines
00037  * @ingroup Git
00038  * @{
00039  */
00040 GIT_BEGIN_DECL
00041 
00042 /**
00043  * Lookup a tree object from the repository.
00044  *
00045  * @param tree pointer to the looked up tree
00046  * @param repo the repo to use when locating the tree.
00047  * @param id identity of the tree to locate.
00048  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00049  */
00050 GIT_INLINE(int) git_tree_lookup(git_tree **tree, git_repository *repo, const git_oid *id)
00051 {
00052         return git_object_lookup((git_object **)tree, repo, id, GIT_OBJ_TREE);
00053 }
00054 
00055 /**
00056  * Close an open tree
00057  *
00058  * This is a wrapper around git_object_close()
00059  *
00060  * IMPORTANT:
00061  * It *is* necessary to call this method when you stop
00062  * using a tree. Failure to do so will cause a memory leak.
00063  *
00064  * @param tree the tree to close
00065  */
00066 
00067 GIT_INLINE(void) git_tree_close(git_tree *tree)
00068 {
00069         git_object_close((git_object *) tree);
00070 }
00071 
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * Get the id of a tree.
00075  *
00076  * @param tree a previously loaded tree.
00077  * @return object identity for the tree.
00078  */
00079 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_tree_id(git_tree *tree);
00080 
00081 /**
00082  * Get the number of entries listed in a tree
00083  *
00084  * @param tree a previously loaded tree.
00085  * @return the number of entries in the tree
00086  */
00087 GIT_EXTERN(size_t) git_tree_entrycount(git_tree *tree);
00088 
00089 /**
00090  * Lookup a tree entry by its filename
00091  *
00092  * @param tree a previously loaded tree.
00093  * @param filename the filename of the desired entry
00094  * @return the tree entry; NULL if not found
00095  */
00096 GIT_EXTERN(const git_tree_entry *) git_tree_entry_byname(git_tree *tree, const char *filename);
00097 
00098 /**
00099  * Lookup a tree entry by its position in the tree
00100  *
00101  * @param tree a previously loaded tree.
00102  * @param idx the position in the entry list
00103  * @return the tree entry; NULL if not found
00104  */
00105 GIT_EXTERN(const git_tree_entry *) git_tree_entry_byindex(git_tree *tree, int idx);
00106 
00107 /**
00108  * Get the UNIX file attributes of a tree entry
00109  *
00110  * @param entry a tree entry
00111  * @return attributes as an integer
00112  */
00113 GIT_EXTERN(unsigned int) git_tree_entry_attributes(const git_tree_entry *entry);
00114 
00115 /**
00116  * Get the filename of a tree entry
00117  *
00118  * @param entry a tree entry
00119  * @return the name of the file
00120  */
00121 GIT_EXTERN(const char *) git_tree_entry_name(const git_tree_entry *entry);
00122 
00123 /**
00124  * Get the id of the object pointed by the entry
00125  *
00126  * @param entry a tree entry
00127  * @return the oid of the object
00128  */
00129 GIT_EXTERN(const git_oid *) git_tree_entry_id(const git_tree_entry *entry);
00130 
00131 /**
00132  * Convert a tree entry to the git_object it points too.
00133  *
00134  * @param object pointer to the converted object
00135  * @param repo repository where to lookup the pointed object
00136  * @param entry a tree entry
00137  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00138  */
00139 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tree_entry_2object(git_object **object_out, git_repository *repo, const git_tree_entry *entry);
00140 
00141 /**
00142  * Write a tree to the ODB from the index file
00143  *
00144  * This method will scan the index and write a representation
00145  * of its current state back to disk; it recursively creates
00146  * tree objects for each of the subtrees stored in the index,
00147  * but only returns the OID of the root tree. This is the OID
00148  * that can be used e.g. to create a commit.
00149  *
00150  * The index instance cannot be bare, and needs to be associated
00151  * to an existing repository.
00152  *
00153  * @param oid Pointer where to store the written tree
00154  * @param index Index to write
00155  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00156  */
00157 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_tree_create_fromindex(git_oid *oid, git_index *index);
00158 
00159 /**
00160  * Create a new tree builder.
00161  *
00162  * The tree builder can be used to create or modify
00163  * trees in memory and write them as tree objects to the
00164  * database.
00165  *
00166  * If the `source` parameter is not NULL, the tree builder
00167  * will be initialized with the entries of the given tree.
00168  * 
00169  * If the `source` parameter is NULL, the tree builder will
00170  * have no entries and will have to be filled manually.
00171  *
00172  * @param builder_p Pointer where to store the tree builder
00173  * @param source Source tree to initialize the builder (optional)
00174  * @return 0 on sucess; error code otherwise
00175  */
00176 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_treebuilder_create(git_treebuilder **builder_p, const git_tree *source);
00177 
00178 /**
00179  * Clear all the entires in the builder
00180  *
00181  * @param bld Builder to clear
00182  */
00183 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_treebuilder_clear(git_treebuilder *bld);
00184 
00185 /**
00186  * Free a tree builder
00187  *
00188  * This will clear all the entries and free to builder.
00189  * Failing to free the builder after you're done using it
00190  * will result in a memory leak
00191  *
00192  * @param bld Builder to free
00193  */
00194 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_treebuilder_free(git_treebuilder *bld);
00195 
00196 /**
00197  * Get an entry from the builder from its filename
00198  *
00199  * The returned entry is owned by the builder and should
00200  * not be freed manually.
00201  *
00202  * @param bld Tree builder
00203  * @param filename Name of the entry
00204  * @return pointer to the entry; NULL if not found
00205  */
00206 GIT_EXTERN(const git_tree_entry *) git_treebuilder_get(git_treebuilder *bld, const char *filename);
00207 
00208 /**
00209  * Add or update an entry to the builder
00210  *
00211  * Insert a new entry for `filename` in the builder with the
00212  * given attributes.
00213  *
00214  * if an entry named `filename` already exists, its attributes
00215  * will be updated with the given ones.
00216  *
00217  * The optional pointer `entry_out` can be used to retrieve a
00218  * pointer to the newly created/updated entry.
00219  *
00220  * @param entry_out Pointer to store the entry (optional)
00221  * @param bld Tree builder
00222  * @param filename Filename of the entry
00223  * @param id SHA1 oid of the entry
00224  * @param attributes Folder attributes of the entry
00225  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00226  */
00227 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_treebuilder_insert(git_tree_entry **entry_out, git_treebuilder *bld, const char *filename, const git_oid *id, unsigned int attributes);
00228 
00229 /**
00230  * Remove an entry from the builder by its filename
00231  *
00232  * @param bld Tree builder
00233  * @param filename Filename of the entry to remove
00234  */
00235 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_treebuilder_remove(git_treebuilder *bld, const char *filename);
00236 
00237 /**
00238  * Filter the entries in the tree
00239  *
00240  * The `filter` callback will be called for each entry
00241  * in the tree with a pointer to the entry and the
00242  * provided `payload`: if the callback returns 1, the
00243  * entry will be filtered (removed from the builder).
00244  *
00245  * @param bld Tree builder
00246  * @param filter Callback to filter entries
00247  */
00248 GIT_EXTERN(void) git_treebuilder_filter(git_treebuilder *bld, int (*filter)(const git_tree_entry *, void *), void *payload);
00249 
00250 /**
00251  * Write the contents of the tree builder as a tree object
00252  *
00253  * The tree builder will be written to the given `repo`, and
00254  * it's identifying SHA1 hash will be stored in the `oid`
00255  * pointer.
00256  *
00257  * @param oid Pointer where to store the written OID
00258  * @param repo Repository where to store the object
00259  * @param bld Tree builder to write
00260  * @return 0 on success; error code otherwise
00261  */
00262 GIT_EXTERN(int) git_treebuilder_write(git_oid *oid, git_repository *repo, git_treebuilder *bld);
00263 
00264 /** @} */
00265 GIT_END_DECL
00266 #endif
